message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
List<Map.Entry<String, Integer>> list = new LinkedList<>(map.entrySet());
Collections.sort(list, new Comparator<Map.Entry<String, Integer>>() {
    public int compare(Map.Entry<String, Integer> o1, Map.Entry<String, Integer> o2) {
        return (o2.getValue()).compareTo(o1.getValue());
    }
});

HashMap<String, Integer> temp = new LinkedHashMap<>();
for (Map.Entry<String, Integer> aa : list) {
    temp.put(aa.getKey(), aa.getValue());
}

Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Integer>> it = temp.entrySet().iterator();
while (it.hasNext() && temp.size() > map.size() / 2) {
    it.next();
    it.remove();
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code first sorts the entries in the map based on their values in descending order. Then it creates a new LinkedHashMap to maintain the order of the entries. After that, it iterates over the sorted entries and removes the bottom half of the entries. The condition temp.size() > map.size() / 2 ensures that only the top half of the entries remain in the map.
